title: Tule Lake Unit: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park       Looking for more information about Tule Lake and World War II Valor in the Pacific? Explore the other pages in this section to learn more.   News News and a series of newsletters and informational updates to keep you updated on what is happening at the Tule Lake Unit.  Photos & Multimedia From Japanese American artists to film and new media view stories about relocation and internment camp life and the aftermath.   History & Culture The Tule Lake Unit of the World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument will bring increased understanding of the high price paid by some Americans on the home front. The Tule Lake Segregation Center National Historic Landmark and nearby Camp Tule Lake in California were both used to incarcerate Japanese Americans forcibly removed from the west coast of the United States.   Education We have included a "virtual library" of articles and papers on the internment, relocation and imprisonment of Japanese Americans and people of Japanese descent. Management The Tule Lake Unit of World War II Valor in the Pacific is managed by the staff at nearby Lava Beds National Monument. All staff work for both monuments.  Publications  Information, guides, publications and maps.
